statement.tex: \text{The length $x$ of a rectangle is decreasing}\\ \text{at the rate of 5 cm/min and the width $y$ is}\\ \text{increasing at the rate of 4 cm/min. } \\ \text{When $x=$ 8 cm and $y=$ 6 cm, find the rates}\\ \text{of change of }\\ \text{(a) the perimeter, and }\\ \text{(b) the area of the rectangle}

step.context: \text{What have we been told about the rates}\\ \text{of change of the length (x) and width (y)?}
\text{And similarly, the rate of change of area (A)}\\ \text{will be given by the following}\textbf{ (right or wrong?)}
step.reason: \text{When }A=x\cdot y,\text{ then }\\ \frac{dA}{dt} = \underbrace{x\cdot\frac{dy}{dt} + y\cdot\frac{dx}{dt}}_{\textbf{Product Rule}}.\\ \text{Also, the units of }\frac{dA}{dt}\text{ should be cm}^2/min
